headline: Chocolate Gingersnaps
description: Molasses, chocolate chips, and warm spices are a delicious match in these chocolate gingersnaps that pair perfectly with a cold glass of milk.
name: Chocolate Gingersnaps

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
Combine butter and brown sugar in a large bowl; beat together until fluffy. Beat in molasses and water.
Combine flour, cocoa, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg in a separate bowl. Slowly mix into the creamed butter mixture until smooth.
Place 1 cup chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl. Melt in the microwave in 15-second intervals, stirring after each interval, 1 to 3 minutes. Add to the dough and mix well.

Shape dough into 1-inch balls and roll in white sugar. Insert 1 chocolate chip into the center of each ball of dough. Make sure you can still see a bit of the chocolate chip sticking out, but not too much. Arrange on baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops begin to crack, 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets for 3 minutes before moving to wire racks to finish cooling.

review.reviewBody: I made this recipe for my mom's birthday She really loved them

I followed the directions carefully except I substituted dark corn syrup for the molasses. My cookies were a disaster! They did not rise and came out looking melted and flat. I am trying to figure out what I did wrong. Maybe my baking soda was too old (expired Oct. 2020). I would love to hear from others who could enlighten me.
I went with half the sugar and a whole teaspoon of ginger. Also, left off rolling them in the sugar at the end.
Substitute cayenne for ginger and make mole cookies.

These are GOOD!! I made the recipe as is and they are perfect! This recipe is the perfect combination of spice and chocolate. I do suggest using a double boiler (if you have one) to melt the chocolate chips. Thanks for an awesome recipe!
